title: Pose series 2, episodes 1 & 2 review - a moreish cocktail of grit and glamour
text:
Here’s one way to keeeeep dancing after the credits roll at the end of Strictly Come Dancing. Saturday nights are also home to a cult show which shimmers with even more glitter than the hoofing contest. Pose (BBC Two), the era-evoking drama about the New York ball scene, was back for its second series, airing in a double bill for a full fix of fashionable fabulousness.

As we returned, it was 1990 and the release of Madonna’s Vogue promised to bring this marginalised subculture into the mainstream. The opening episode throbbed and pulsed to the club anthem, culminating in a giddying dance floor explosion of joy.

However, it wasn’t all sweetness and disco lights. The spectre of the Aids pandemic...
